eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DialogBox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This extension adds Dialog Box functionality that can be used for RPGs, visual novels, and more.
description: ## Summary
This extension adds Dialog Box functionality that can be used for RPGs, visual novels, and more.
## How to use:
1. You will need a background **sprite**, a character **sprite**, a **BBText** to display the name, a **BBText** to display the text, and a **sprite** for the icon to prompt the player for action.
1. Add the "Dialog Box" behavior to the background object.
1. Place each object in the scene.
1. Execute the "Setup Dialog Box" action only once in the event.
1. After that, execute the "Open Dialog Box" action, "Close Dialog Box" action, etc.
## This extension add:
**Dialog Box** - behavior
**Setup Dialog Box** - action
**Open Dialog Box** - action
**Close Dialog Box** - action
**Change Dialog Box Text** - action
**Change Dialog Box contents** - action
**Change Dialog Box typing sound** - action
**Change Dialog Box typing interval** - action
**Skip Dialog Box typing** - action
**Dialog Box is open** - condition
**Dialog Box is typing** - condition
**Dialog Box is close** - condition
**Number of times the Text in Dialog Box has changed** - condition
**Number of times the Text in Dialog Box has changed** - expression
## Tips
This Dialog Box has a useful counter function.
It is zero when the dialog box is opened, and increases by one each time the text changes.
(However, it will not increase until the frame advances).
This feature is useful for keeping track of the progress of a conversation.
## Note
In typing, style tags in BBText OBjects are also counted as characters.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This extension adds the functionality of a dialog box to your game.
Add this to the sprite object that will be the background of the dialog box.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DialogBoxBackGround

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ThreeDFlip
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Flip sprites with a 3D rotation effect.
description: Flip sprites with a 3D rotation effect.
Note that the X origin point must be at the center for the best results.

eventsFunctions.description: Start a flipping animation on the object.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Flip _PARAM0_ over _PARAM2_ms

events.comment: The previous animation is not yet finished, flip the other way around starting from there.
Set the flipped property as if the previous animation has finished.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Stop flipping _PARAM0_

events.comment:
When the object is flipping, the "is flipped" parameter is not yet set,
so it's value is the opposite of the animation goal.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DoubleClick
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_wireless_pc.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check for a double-click with a mouse, or a double-tap on a touchscreen.
description: Allow you to check for double-clicks with the left, middle, or right button of a mouse. It will also allow you to detect double-taps on touchscreens.

Please note: Touch devices do not have alternatives for middle/right clicks. Taps on a touch device will get counted for _any_ use of these conditions, so you should either design your controls accordingly, or build out separate events if the device has a touch screen.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified mouse button is clicked twice in a short amount of time.
eventsFunctions.name: HasDoubleClicked
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ mouse button is double-clicked (or double-tap on a touchscreen)

parameters.longDescription: As touch devices do not have middle/right tap equivalents, you will need to account for this within your events if you're not using the left mouse button and building for touch devices.
parameters.name: MouseButton

eventsFunctions.description: Set the maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to be considered as a double click.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the double-click maximum delay between two clicks (or two taps) to _PARAM1_s

parameters.longDescription: By default, this value is 0.5 seconds.
parameters.name: MaxDelay

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ArrayTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A collection of utilities and tools for working with arrays.
description: > Note: This extension is currently made in JavaScript instead of the event sheet as variables cannot be passed to events based functions yet. Due to this hack, the extension **only works on root scene variables**, not on child variables or non-scene variables.
This extension adds features like:
- Combining arrays (concatenate into new array, append all children to another array)
- Finding a value in an array (find index expression, contains condition)
- Reversing arrays
- Get a portion of an array (slice)
- Add and remove lots of children at specific indices at once (fill, splice, shift, pop, add at index)
- Randomness (shuffle children, get a random child)
- Mathematical operations using arrays (sum of all numbers, biggest/smallest number, average number, median number)
- Sort numbers in an array
- String inter-operation (split string into array, join array array children to string)

eventsFunctions.description: Copies a portion of a scene array variable into a new scene array variable.
eventsFunctions.name: Slice
eventsFunctions.sentence: Slice array _PARAM1_ from indices _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_ into _PARAM2_

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a clean new array
// The `|| undefined` replaces 0 with undefined, as having the argument as 0
// would make the array empty and is therefore useless.
// With undefined though, it doesn't stop until the end of the array,
// Copy each variable of the slice into the new array

parameters.description: The array to take a slice from
parameters.name: arr

parameters.description: The array to store the slice into
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: The index to start the slice from
parameters.name: begin

parameters.description: The index to end the slice at
parameters.longDescription:
Set to 0 to copy all of the array. If you use a negative value, the index will be selected beginning from the end.  
For example, slicing an array with 5 elements from 0 to -1 would take only elements from indices 0 to 3.
parameters.name: end

eventsFunctions.description: Cuts a portion of an array off.
eventsFunctions.name: Splice
eventsFunctions.sentence: Remove _PARAM3_ items from array _PARAM1_ starting from index _PARAM2_

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// Replaces 0 with the legth of the array, as having the argument as 0
// would not remove anything and is therefore useless.

parameters.description: The array to remove items from
parameters.name: arr

parameters.description: The index to start removing from
parameters.longDescription: If you use a negative value, the index will be selected beginning from the end.
parameters.name: begin

parameters.description: The amount of elements to remove
parameters.longDescription: Set to 0 to remove until the end of the array.
parameters.name: count

eventsFunctions.description: Shuffles all children of an array.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Shuffle array _PARAM1_

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array

eventsFunctions.description: Replaces all arrays inside of an array with their children. For example, [[1,2], [3,4]] becomes [1,2,3,4].
eventsFunctions.name: Flatten
eventsFunctions.sentence: Flatten array _PARAM1_ (Deeply flatten: _PARAM2_)

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// At the position of the array (i), remove 1 element (the array),
// and insert elements of b (the contents of the array) in-place of the array.
// Skip over the elements that were just added as we are flattening only 1 level deep
// If deep, the current element has been replaced with another, we need to recheck it on next iteration.
// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.

parameters.longDescription: If yes, will continue flattening until there is no arrays in the array anymore.
parameters.name: deep

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a clean new array

parameters.description: The separator to use to split the string
parameters.longDescription: For example, if you have a string "Hello World", and the separator is a space (" "), the resulting array would be ["Hello", "World"]. If the separator is an empty string (""), it will make an element per character (["H", "e", "l", "l", "o", " ", "W", "o", "r", "l", "d"]).
parameters.name: sep
